description: A human language representation of the concept (resource/element) as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the full intended meaning of the user. This can be provided either directly as text, or as a url that is a reference to a portion of the narrative of a resource ([DomainResource.text](narrative.html)).

element.comment:
The data in the element does not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the original text. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source. This is commonly used to provide "what did the user actually see/type". Note that this extension has the same definition as CodeableConcept.text and SHALL NOT be used on CodeableConcept with type = string in place of CodeableConcept.text but MAY be used with type url. If present on a CodeableConcept with type url as well as CodeableConcept.text, then the CodeableConcept.text SHALL match the referenced narrative. 

It's also possible to link to the resource narrative using the [narrativeLink extension](extension-narrativelink.html) which does not claim that the data is derived from the text.
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept (resource/element) as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the full intended meaning of the user. This can be provided either directly as text, or as a url that is a reference to a portion of the narrative of a resource ([DomainResource.text](narrative.html)).
element.short: Original Text that represents the data as seen/selected/uttered originally

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

title: Original Text
